intro: Bauhinia mollis var. guaranitica, commonly known as the pink bauhinia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its distinctive bipinnate leaves and showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated as a decorative plant. The species is also used in traditional medicine in some parts of its native range.
